title: L'amour a vingt ans AKA Love at Twenty (1962)
description:
Not a sentimental, slushy, romantic movie, but instead a practical, incisive look at relationships (and non-relationships), the film is a snapshot of life/love in the 60s in five different cities.  The segments of the film run as follows: PARIS (Truffaut continues his Ã¢â‚¬ËœAntoine DoinelÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ series with a brief but intense flirtation), WARSAW (Wajda presents a quirky tangent about animal attraction), ROME (Renzo Rossellini Ã¢â‚¬â€œ son of Roberto Ã¢â‚¬â€œ sets up a short and simple piece and then leaves us hanging), TOKYO (IshiharaÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s contribution strikes the only false note and belongs in a different anthology entirely), and MUNICH (whereupon Marcel Ophuls Ã¢â‚¬â€œ son of Max Ã¢â‚¬â€œ reaffirms to us at the end of this film what we wanted to believe about love all along).
